Group.synopsis:
Three people are having an argument. Rolan, Lia and Cal. Lia and Cal are brother and sister, but the three of them have grown up together. They're young, talented tieflings who are heading to Baldur's Gate to start their lives and careers. Rolan argues that they should leave now and get to the city while they still can. Lia argues that it is irresponsible to leave their kin behind. Cal is stuck in the middle.
This is a passionate and fiery argument, both sides are convinced that they are correct.

Sister.synopsis: This occurs after the argument betwen Lia and Rolan. Lia is still stewing after the fight. Opportunity to get to know her better and understand the group dynamics.
Sister.how_to_trigger: from crashsitein reCon: teleport S_GLO_ProdigySisterclick on Lia, go through group dialogueclick on Lia after group dialogue (different paths if you convinced them to stay or go)

Brother.synopsis: This dialog occurs after the argument between Lia and Rolan that Cal attempted to mediate. It's light and friendly, and mainly a chance for the player to get to know Cal.
Brother.how_to_trigger: skip Tutorialgoto 206; 525speak with Cal after breaking up the fight

Dead.synopsis: Rolan has been killed. Even in corpse form, his desire to become the greatest wizard in all of Faerun is clear.

AD.synopsis: This occurs betwen Lia, Cal and Ronan. There are mixed ADs which occur - when they're arguing about when to stay and go, when they've decided to stay and when they've decided to go.

individual_metadata.synopsis: This occurs after the argument with Lia. If they're leaving for Baldur's Gate he's pretty relaxed about the argument and dismissive of Lia and her concerns. If they're staying in the grove, he's furious and is convinced they'll die here.

Group_3.speaker: Lia
Group_3.text: Hells, we can't just leave. They're kin.
Group_3.context: NodeContext: This is the start of the dialog but clearly an ongoing argument. You think it's your responsibility, as a tiefling, to stay and help your kin. You're angry, voice is level but will soon grow louder, and utterly convinced that staying at the camp is the right thing to do.

Group_45.speaker: Rolan
Group_45.text: I'll not gamble our lives, our futures, on people who are as good as dead. We must leave for Baldur's Gate - at once.
Group_45.context: NodeContext: You're angry but your voice is level. You think staying at the camp is essentially suicide. You cannot believe it was even suggested. You and your friends have brand new lives waiting for you in Baldur's Gate - to stay at the camp is reckless and pointless to you.

Group_10.speaker: Cal
Group_10.text: Can we all just take a moment? Please?
Group_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking for one to the other. Stuck in between them, pleading. Hands out as he tries to calm the situation. NodeContext: Your friend and sister are screaming at each other in front of you. Light and easygoing tone as you try to calm the argument.

Group_47.speaker: Lia
Group_47.text: What's the point in blades and spells if we don't bloody use them? We should stay.
Group_47.context: NodeContext: Your voice is getting louder. You're very angry now. It's your civic duty to use the skills you have to help people. You cannot believe how selfish Rolan is being.

Group_21.speaker: Lia
Group_21.text: These people aren't fighters. We can help.

Group_43.speaker: Cal
Group_43.text: Or yell louder. That's fine too.
Group_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sighing as he shrugs. He knows neither is listening to him. NodeContext: Your friend and sister have ignored your plea. You know once they've started they'll just keep arguing until one of them gives in. This is almost said with a shrug and in a light, jokey tone.

Group_5.speaker: Cal
Group_5.text: Rolan's right, sis. We should leave - while we still can.
Group_5.context: NodeContext: You've decided to intervene and try to calm the situation. Your voice is light but gentle. You don't wish to fight with your sister and you definitely don't want to see her hurt but staying.

Group_56.speaker: Lia
Group_56.text: Argh. Fine. Let's sneak away like godsdamned cowards.
Group_56.context: NodeContext:  You know you've lost the argument and this is a last little dig at the end. It's your temper getting the better of you. You're not yelling, but it's said with quiet fury.

Group_40.speaker: Lia
Group_40.text: But if something happens to these people, it's on us. I hope you know that.
Group_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turning away in a huff. Arms crossed, Angry. NodeContext: Ibid.

Group_39.speaker: Player
Group_39.text: Get out while you can - the goblins will be back.

Group_20.speaker: Rolan
Group_20.text: Common sense at last. Let's get out of this death trap.
Group_20.context: NodeContext: Player has agreed with you. Said almost as you throw you hands in the air. You think it's ludicrous that anyone WOULDN'T agree with you.

Group_30.speaker: Cal
Group_30.text: C'mon, sis. We're less of a target alone. We should leave.
Group_30.context: NodeContext: You've decided to intervene and try to calm the situation. Your voice is light but gentle. You don't wish to fight with your sister and you definitely don't want to see her hurt but staying.

Group_18.speaker: Player
Group_18.text: You should all stay. A single blade could make a difference.

Group_28.speaker: Lia
Group_28.text: Thank you! It's the right thing to do, and you know it.
Group_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gestures towards player at thank you but is looking at Rolan. NodeContext: The player has agreed with you. Thank you is directed at player, the rest at Rolan. You know the argument has likely been won by you - trying to appeal to his morality.

Group_53.speaker: Cal
Group_53.text: She's right, Rolan. We're better than this.
Group_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Almost nudging Rolan with a smile on his face.NodeContext: You've decided to intervene and try to calm the situation. Your voice is light but gentle.

Group_34.speaker: Rolan
Group_34.text: Zurgan. Fine. I'll stay too. Lest you both end up with your throats slit by a goblin blade.
Group_34.context: NodeContext: 'ZUR-gan.' You know you've lost and you are NOT being gracious. Rolling your eyes - you love them both but are playing up you staying - like you're doing them a favour.

Group_11.speaker: Rolan
Group_11.text: No. This place is a death trap. Let us leave - immediately!
Group_11.context: NodeContext: Player has disagreed with you. You're frustrated and angry. You think it's ludicrous that anyone would disagree with you.

Group_4.speaker: Rolan
Group_4.text: Or would you deny your brother here his chance at fortune in Baldur's Gate?
Group_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at Lia but gesturing to Cal. NodeContext: You know the argument is likely going your way and you're being a little bit of a dick here. You know mentioning Lia's brother is a guarantee that she'll give in to your side and leave with you. It's a bit of an underhanded move.

Group_55.speaker: Player
Group_55.text: You want fortune? There's coin in it if you stay.

Group_15.speaker: Lia
Group_15.text: You know, that money could go towards a spiffy new outfit for your apprenticeship...?
Group_15.context: NodeContext: Smile, knowing rolan will give in

Group_12.speaker: Rolan
Group_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Generic 'taking' animation. Taking coin from the player.NodeContext: 'ZUR-gan.' Frustrated but giving in to the promise of going.

Group_8.speaker: Rolan
Group_8.text: If we survive, it'll make for a good story I suppose...
Group_8.context: NodeContext: Kinda sulky but accepting that you'll stay in the grove.

Group_14.speaker: Lia
Group_14.text: Thank you, Rolan. And thank you, friend.
Group_14.context: NodeContext: Warm and sincere. Directed at rolan and then player.

Group_48.speaker: Rolan
Group_48.text: But it is, nevertheless, true. We've risked everything to get this far, we can't afford to throw it all away.

Group_1.speaker: Player
Group_1.text: Clan is everything. You don't abandon those you swore to protect.

Group_27.speaker: Rolan
Group_27.text: I made no such oath, and I will not be held responsible for these people.

Group_9.speaker: Player
Group_9.text: If they cannot fight, they will die. That is as it should be.

Group_25.speaker: Rolan
Group_25.text: Exactly! These types always need saving. We shouldn't sacrifice ourselves for them.

Group_36.speaker: Player
Group_36.text: Have you forgotten Elturel? We should stand by our people - no one else will.

Group_42.speaker: Rolan
Group_42.text: This isn't Elturel and I'm not responsible for every damn tiefling in the world!

Group_17.speaker: Lia
Group_17.text: Just be responsible for yourself then. We have to stay; it's the right thing to do.

Group_37.speaker: Rolan
Group_37.text: Zurgan. Fine! We'll stay. If we survive, it'll make for a good story I suppose...

Group_16.speaker: Lia
Group_16.context: NodeContext: Said sincerely - you've seen Rolan fight and you want him at your side.

Group_38.speaker: Player
Group_38.text: Only cowards run from a fight.

Group_44.speaker: Lia
Group_44.text: Prove them wrong, then. If you think you're able to, that is.

Group_49.speaker: Player
Group_49.text: I'd choose the wilderness over the dangers of a city any day. Stay.

Group_22.speaker: Rolan
Group_22.text: What? The dangers of overpriced taverns and muddy streets? I think I'll take that risk.

Group_33.speaker: Lia
Group_33.text: The city's not going anywhere. I'm staying - we're needed here.

Group_0.speaker: Player
Group_0.text: Why die for those who can't defend themselves?

Group_32.speaker: Rolan
Group_32.text: Exactly! Hear that, Lia? We're not helping anyone if we're corpses.

Group_29.speaker: Player
Group_29.text: To leave is a heavy choice - it will weigh on whatever path you walk next.

Group_31.speaker: Lia
Group_31.text: Just like I was saying. I don't want all these lives on my conscience. We need to stay.

Group_51.speaker: Player
Group_51.text: 'Where the weak have need, the strong have a duty'. Stay.

Sister_0.speaker: Lia
Sister_0.text: Those goblins will rue the day they chose to tangle with this grove.

Sister_2.speaker: Lia
Sister_2.text: You and I will do some good here - I can feel it.

Sister_3.speaker: Lia
Sister_3.text: I keep dreaming I'll wake up with my throat slit. May your sleep be more pleasant.
Sister_3.context: NodeContext: Said with a heavy sigh and sadness.

Sister_4.speaker: Lia
Sister_4.text: I hate it, but Rolan is right. Every moment here is another we risk dying at the hands of greenskins.

Sister_1.speaker: Lia
Sister_1.text: You'd best get out too - while there's still time.

Brother_0.speaker: Cal
Brother_0.text: Lia and Rolan would never admit it, but they'd take an arrow for the other. Also stab each other. Not sure what'll come first.
Brother_0.context: NodeContext: You have broken up a fight between Lia and Rolan more times than you can count. You're tone is light and friendly as you joke with the player.

Brother_1.speaker: Cal
Brother_1.text: Thanks for cutting in - there might have been more than words if you hadn't.
Brother_1.context: NodeContext: A big friendly smile - you are the most genuine of the group

Brother_2.speaker: Cal
Brother_2.text: Here's hoping we all make it in one piece.
Brother_2.context: NodeContext: This is a joke. Said with a grin.

Dead_24.speaker: Narrator
Dead_24.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Dead_26.speaker: Player
Dead_26.text: No family? What about Lia and Cal?

Dead_1.speaker: Rolan
Dead_1.text: They are... brother and sister. Cal says... I am family, but...

Dead_9.speaker: Rolan
Dead_9.text: With Lia... and Cal. They are brother and sister. But I am... not blood.

Dead_29.speaker: Rolan
Dead_29.text: Too fast but... can't be. Must finish...

Dead_3.speaker: Rolan
Dead_3.text: My... training... must get to... Lorroakan.

Dead_10.speaker: Rolan
Dead_10.text: To Baldur's Gate... to Lorroakan... my destiny.

Dead_6.speaker: Player
Dead_6.text: What is so important about Lorroakan?

Dead_7.speaker: Rolan
Dead_7.text: Everything. He'll make me... greatest wizard... in Faerûn.

Dead_30.speaker: Narrator
Dead_30.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Dead_31.speaker: Narrator
Dead_31.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

AD_3.speaker: Lia
AD_3.text: This is about your precious Baldur's Gate.
AD_3.context: NodeContext: The argument is getting a little nastier now - and personal. This is a dig at Rolan and you know it.

AD_24.speaker: Rolan
AD_24.text: I care about our lives. Our futures.
AD_24.context: NodeContext: This is heated - the argument is getting personal.

AD_26.speaker: Lia
AD_26.text: No. You just care about your stupid apprenticeship.
AD_26.context: NodeContext: This is a personal dig at Rolan and you know it - purposefully jabbing at him,

AD_32.speaker: Rolan
AD_32.context: NodeContext: Lia has baited you and you've absolutely risen to it. Heated and personal.

AD_7.speaker: Cal
AD_7.text: How long will it take to get to Baldur's Gate?
AD_7.context: NodeContext: Cheerful, you're glad the argument is over. Bantering with your family.

AD_5.speaker: Rolan
AD_5.text: Depends. How often are you going to ask that?
AD_5.context: NodeContext: A note of humour in your voice - very much a 'are we there yet, are we there yet' situation.

AD_14.speaker: Cal
AD_14.text: Hey, sis. How long will it take to get to Baldur's Gate?
AD_14.context: NodeContext: You know you're being annoying and you're enjoying yourself.

AD_28.speaker: Lia
AD_28.context: NodeContext: A big dramatic sigh even as you're enjoying the banter,

AD_16.speaker: Rolan
AD_16.text: We don't even know these people!
AD_16.context: NodeContext: Arguing with Lia. He thinks her suggestion to stay is suicide.

AD_8.speaker: Lia
AD_8.context: NodeContext: Rolan has claimed you don't even know the other tieflings. You're snapping back.

AD_4.speaker: Rolan
AD_4.text: Of course it does. You would choose strangers over us!

AD_2.speaker: Cal
AD_2.context: NodeContext: You sister and your best friend are arguing and it's getting progressively heated. You're trying to calm the situation but you also know they're going to keep ignoring you.

AD_17.speaker: Rolan
AD_17.text: We should add the Elfsong Tavern to the list.
AD_17.context: NodeContext: Talking about things to do in Baldur's Gate - excited.

AD_30.speaker: Lia
AD_30.context: NodeContext: A wry smile, you're happy to see your Rolan so excited.

AD_23.speaker: Cal
AD_23.text: Drinks on Rolan? Count me in.
AD_23.context: NodeContext: Your sister has conned Rolan into paying - you're teasing him.

AD_15.speaker: Rolan
AD_15.text: I swear, I've never met such a pair of cheapskates.
AD_15.context: NodeContext: A wry smile even as you pretend to be grumpy - Lia and Rolan are teasing you and you're pretending to hate it.

AD_20.speaker: Cal
AD_20.text: How long until Rolan shows off his Thunderwave?
AD_20.context: NodeContext: You and your sister are talking to each other - teasing Rolan.

AD_6.speaker: Lia
AD_6.text: Depends. How many people are dumb enough to ask?
AD_6.context: NodeContext: Ibid. A smile - Rolan has a massive ego but you love him for it.

AD_31.speaker: Cal
AD_31.context: NodeContext: You laugh at your sister's barb.

AD_21.speaker: Rolan
AD_21.text: I'd die if I met Lorroakan reeking of this place.
AD_21.context: NodeContext: Half talking to yourself as you look down at your robes.

AD_12.speaker: Rolan
AD_12.text: I'll never get the smell out of my clothes.

AD_22.speaker: Cal
AD_22.text: Don't be grumpy, Rolan. We'll get to the city soon.

AD_0.speaker: Rolan
AD_0.context: NodeContext: You are grumpy but few can cheer you up like Cal can.

AD_9.speaker: Cal
AD_9.text: The scowl on your face would frighten a troll.
AD_9.context: NodeContext: A big smile as you tease Rolan, knowing you're cheering him up.

AD_18.speaker: Rolan
AD_18.context: NodeContext: Despite your best efforts a smile breaks out on your face - you tease Cal back.

AD_27.speaker: Cal
AD_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cal is looking from Rolan to Lia. NodeContext: You sister and your best friend are arguing and it's getting progressively heated. You're trying to calm the situation.

AD_13.speaker: Lia
AD_13.context: NodeContext: Yelling at Rolan. He's suggested leaving your fellow tieflings behind and you're furious.

AD_1.speaker: Rolan
AD_1.text: You're going to get us killed!
AD_1.context: NodeContext: Arguing with Lia. He thinks her suggestion to stay is suicide.

AD_29.speaker: Lia
AD_29.text: Stay close to me out there.
AD_29.context: NodeContext: Concern radiating from you. You're worried about leaving and are fiercly protective of

AD_10.speaker: Rolan
AD_10.context: NodeContext: Lia has warned you to stay close to her. You're needling her but it's in good fun.

AD_25.speaker: Lia
AD_25.text: I will punch you in the throat, Rolan.
AD_25.context: NodeContext: A smile even as you threaten this - classic sibling banter.

48.speaker: Rolan
48.text: We should have left by now. Damnation.
48.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated. Having a little bit of a tantrum, to be honest. Not used to not getting his way.

104.speaker: Rolan
104.text: Instead we're just sitting here - practically begging to be attacked. Staying is a mistake.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: You're doing the right thing. The others need help.

69.speaker: Rolan
69.text: And what about us? There's every chance we've doomed ourselves by helping these people.

100.speaker: Rolan
100.text: We will end up fodder for some goblin's blade - all because Lia insists on helping every wounded foal we see.

89.speaker: Rolan
89.text: Our best chance to make it to Baldur's Gate is on our own. This place is lost.

20.speaker: Rolan
20.context: NodeContext: Player has asked why the hurry to the city. His career and his magic is more important to him than his life. This apprenticeship means EVERYTHING to him.

17.speaker: Rolan
17.text: My apprenticeship with Lorroakan begins shortly. I cannot be late.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Leave on your own. Why wait?

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Worrying won't help. I'm sure you'll be fine.

81.speaker: Rolan
81.text: Of course I will be. As if there was any doubt.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Standing by your people is never a mistake.

24.speaker: Rolan
24.text: It is if we end up dead.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: So eager to go to Baldur's Gate - do they even welcome tieflings?

75.speaker: Rolan
75.text: More than most. A few strangers may stare - but they'll keep their daggers sheathed.

11.speaker: Rolan
11.text: I'll be warmly received, besides. You are looking at Lorroakan's newest apprentice.

50.speaker: Rolan
50.text: I wonder what Lorroakan will have me do first? Complex magic, no doubt.

54.speaker: Rolan
54.text: I can spare but a moment - Baldur's Gate awaits! Oh, I can almost smell the city.
54.context: NodeContext: Leaving for Baldur's Gate after a hell of an argument but isn't bothered. Excited to be leaving and seems oblvious to that fact that Lia is next to him, SEETHING.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: You're cheerful for someone about to abandon his kin.

112.speaker: Rolan
112.text: Well, you're here, aren't you? You can help them if you want.

39.speaker: Rolan
39.text: I don't believe in sacrifices for a lost cause.

56.speaker: Rolan
56.text: We're leaving for Baldur's Gate. And we will make it.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Hold on. Why are you so eager to reach the city?

87.speaker: Rolan
87.text: Tch. You're as bad as Lia.

45.speaker: Rolan
45.text: And I think one of her is quite enough in my life. Good day to you.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: There's every chance you'll die on the road.

98.speaker: Rolan
98.text: Please. I can handle myself. It's others that are the issue.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: You made the right choice. This place isn't safe.

92.speaker: Rolan
92.text: Quite right. Lia can be stubborn at times.

32.speaker: Rolan
32.text: This place, and its people, are lost. The only way we'll make it to Baldur's Gate is on our own.

70.speaker: Rolan
70.text: And we will make it. I know it.

38.speaker: Rolan
38.text: Other than a desire to avoid impending death?

2.speaker: Rolan
2.text: You are looking at Lorroakan's newest apprentice.
2.context: NodeContext: Excited, Eyes light up. This is his dream. He believes he is DESTINED for this.

23.speaker: Rolan
23.text: Yes - that Lorroakan. The greatest wizard in Baldur's Gate.
23.context: NodeContext: xcited, Eyes light up. This is his dream. He believes he is DESTINED for this.

34.speaker: Gale
34.text: I've heard that name before. A young man, yes? Lives in Ramazith's Tower in the Upper City?

110.speaker: Gale
110.text: Word in Waterdeep has it he's a bit of a cad. But you say he's an accomplished wizard?

103.speaker: Rolan
103.text: Of course he is! The greatest spellcaster along the Sword Coast. As if I'd settle for a lesser mentor.

25.speaker: Gale
25.text: In that case, I'd very much appreciate it if you could arrange an introduction should we reach the city.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Good idea: powerful acquaintances never hurt.

36.speaker: Rolan
36.text: If it's powerful acquaintances you're after, you have to look no further than yours truly.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Hold on. I'm not sure about this Lorroakan.

68.speaker: Rolan
68.text: Don't be fooled by mere gossip! The by-products of ignorance and jealousy.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: We need to go. We have a more pressing problem, remember?

6.speaker: Gale
6.text: Merely planning ahead. Besides, never hurts to befriend a wizard.

7.speaker: Rolan
7.text: In that case, it is I you should befriend.

18.speaker: Rolan
18.text: Few can match me - in either magic or talent.

79.speaker: Rolan
79.text: In years to come, you will boast of this meeting - I can assure you. May we meet again in Baldur's Gate, my friend.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: I've heard stories about Lorroakan - not all of them good.

21.speaker: Rolan
21.text: Common gossip! The by-products of ignorance and jealousy.

13.speaker: Rolan
13.text: I've admired Lorroakan for years. Never dreamed he'd answer my letter.
13.context: NodeContext: Eyes light up as he discusses his hero. He looks and sounds younger in this moment. Pure enthusiasm and excitement.

28.speaker: Rolan
28.text: But I've worked myself to the bone for this. Few can match me - in either magic or talent.
28.context: NodeContext: Determined even as he's sounding overconfident. He has truly has worked his ass off to get here.

94.speaker: Rolan
94.text: The names 'Rolan' and 'Lorroakan' will be known far and wide. You'll see.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Never heard of him. Who is he?

16.speaker: Player
16.text: There are many things I feel I should know... but I don't.

83.speaker: Rolan
83.text: What? You don't know of him? I've admired him for years.
83.context: NodeContext: Pride and awe in his voice. He's clearly imagining himself in the same position.

14.speaker: Rolan
14.text: Forgive me. Of course someone like you wouldn't know.
14.context: NodeContext: You think you're being kind but you're just being a condescending dick

0.speaker: Rolan
0.text: Both his magic and political sway are forces to be reckoned with.

109.speaker: Rolan
109.text: Rest assured, the names 'Rolan' and 'Lorroakan' will be known to you soon enough. You'll see.
109.context: NodeContext: Dismissive shrug. Stating this like a fact.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Is this Lorroakan of Ramazith's Tower?

43.speaker: Rolan
43.text: His name is known far and wide, I see.
43.context: NodeContext: Player says the know the wizard he speaks of. Happily surprised to see.

27.speaker: Rolan
27.text: Few can match him in terms of raw power and talent. Until now, that is.
27.context: NodeContext: Smug and arrogant. He is powerful and he is talented. He's just smug about it.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: I've heard he's quite the scoundrel.

101.speaker: Rolan
101.text: Common gossip! The by-products of ignorance and jealousy.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Perhaps the right master can rid you of your arrogance.

66.speaker: Rolan
66.text: Please - this is confidence, not arrogance.
66.context: NodeContext: Player has told him not be cocky. Dismissive of their words. He's good and he knows it.

99.speaker: Rolan
99.text: But thank you for your concern. It was touching.
99.context: NodeContext: Sarcasm. He's irritated by what he perceives as the player's criticism.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Why burden yourself with companions? You should slip away - alone.

88.speaker: Rolan
88.text: ... but I could never leave Lia behind, as irksome as she may be.

107.speaker: Rolan
107.text: If only she understood. The longer we wait, the longer the horrors of the wilds imperil us.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: Baldur's Gate isn't going anywhere. Why the hurry?

19.speaker: Rolan
19.text: I have been offered an apprenticeship by none other than Lorroakan.

64.speaker: Rolan
64.text: Yes - that Lorroakan. The greatest wizard in Baldur's Gate. This will change everything.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: You don't wish to help your fellow tieflings?

95.speaker: Rolan
95.text: If we stop and help every wounded foal, we'll end up dead, or worse. Lia just can't see it.

90.speaker: Rolan
90.text: We must leave soon. My apprenticeship with the wizard begins shortly.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: If you want to go, then go.

15.speaker: Rolan
15.text: Bah. I couldn't abandon her. No matter how prestigious the apprenticeship.
15.context: NodeContext: This clearly bothers you much more than you are trying to show. You love Lia but it pains you not to be in Baldur's Gate.

62.speaker: Rolan
62.text: I'm to study under Lorroakan, you see.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I've heard the Elfsong Tavern makes a mean bowl of stew.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: You're leaving? Good. Save your own skin to fight another day.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: What's so special about Baldur's Gate? Everyone here is so focused on it.

5.speaker: Rolan
5.text: You are in for a treat, my otherworldly friend. There is no city in the Realms like Baldur's Gate.

29.speaker: Rolan
29.text: From its sights, to its smells, to the fortunes you can make. I myself am set to make history there...
29.context: NodeContext: very much enjoying the sound of your own voice

72.speaker: Rolan
72.text: ... as apprentice to Lorroakan, the greatest wizard in Baldur's Gate. This will change everything.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: The aroma of the Outer City is pretty unique.

55.speaker: Rolan
55.text: As if I would be found in such a place. No, I am destined for greater things.

106.speaker: Rolan
106.text: My Thunderwave will make quick work of any goblin - just you wait.
